platform_choice: I would like to know which types of analytics technologies are used to improve ad performance.
duration_of_role: Between 5 years to less than 10 years
purpose: I think the purpose of the study is to assess and find solutions with regards to misinformation and fake news issues.
feedback: I strongly support initiatives regarding misinformation and fake news issues specially at this moment throughout the world which could undermine world’s prosperity and democratic systems. When conducted by a high prestige and internationally respected institution as Stanford it gives hope for a non-biased analysis in this field. My vote for slightly left-wing biased intends to bring to light the risks with relationship with other associations around the world which could have a strong biased team out of Stanford eyes. The misinformation debate now-a-days is closely related to activism information production. Both institutions available to choose for donations in this research appeared to be either using activism-political maneuvers to justify studies or were supported by political activists in Brazil. The curious part is that in both cases it was related to the left-wing.
final_role_type: Legal

platform_choice: I would not like to receive this information.
duration_of_role: Between 5 years to less than 10 years
purpose: It's a guerilla ad campaign disguised as a survey to get users to use a service that prevents their ads from showing up on sites they don't want them on.
feedback: I wonder how customers can punish a company for their ads appearing on a hate site, if those customers themselves never go to the hate site? Kind of like my parents yelling at me for having my eyes open during prayers when I was a kid, they obviously had to have their eyes open to see that I did. I understand if it's a big company like Nike and it spills over into a newsworthy item, but for small companies this is essentially a non-issue for all practical purposes because their customers who would be angry about their ad appearing in a misinformation site will never see it since they don't go to those sites. On the other hand, money is money and the people who do frequent those sites might be good customers. So while it's an ethics issue, it's really unethical to spin it as a financial loss issue for any but the largest companies.
final_role_type: Top executive (e.g. chief executives, general and operations managers of multiple departments or locations, legislators)

misinfo_intro: I have carefully read the above information.
consumer_info_demand: I would like to find out how many people switched away from getting the company's products or services.
info_session_self_reported_demand: I would not like to sign up for this consultation.
platform_choice: I would like to know which platforms least frequently place companies' ads on misinformation websites.
duration_of_role: Between 10 years to less than 20 years
purpose: Possibly develop statistics to promote startups and others for so-called disinformation.
feedback: I am alarmed that Stanford (with which I have had several very high-level positions, as well as with several major Silicon Valley entities) is involved in a project like this. The survey comes across as showing that the project sponsors somehow believe that right minded people can and should decide what is and isn't misinformation and then should advise advertisers as to where it is and isn’t ok for them to place their ads. By causing advertisers to shun concepts not in the mainstream thinking, you can put people and entities that support contrary positions out of business. No matter how well meaning, this type of monitoring, flagging and censorship is extremely dangerous. These are the people who, during Galileo’s time, would censor anyone supporting the idea that the earth revolves around the sun, contrary to longstanding scientific and religious truth. They would deny that maybe ulcers can be treated with antibiotics instead of surgery. They would deny that maybe Covid was badly handled. They would deny that there was such a thing as the Hunter Biden laptop. These types of U.S. Taliban can and would cause extreme damage in pursuit of their righteous cause.
final_role_type: Other occupation (please specify):

misinfo_intro: I have carefully read the above information.
consumer_info_demand: I would like to find out how many people opted to sign a petition to voice concerns about company practices online.
info_session_self_reported_demand: I would not like to sign up for this consultation.
info_treatment: I have carefully read the above information.
platform_choice: I would not like to receive this information.
duration_of_role: Between 5 years to less than 10 years
industry_11_TEXT: Legal Practice and I run an NGO and Consulting company too.
purpose: To be used for policy development to regulate information on the internet and to create a social contract that holds online companies responsible for misinformation or that deters them from it. More like creating a duty of care to dispense accurate information.
feedback: I think that the area of information regulation on the internet is tricky because the issue of trust in the so called fact checking entities that flag posts as misinformation is unresolved. In my experience with the #EndSars movement and the resultant killing of the youths at the Lekki Toll gate being the venue of the final rally. Nigerians were mortified to find Facebook flagging photos and posts from that night shootings as FALSE! This bred so much distrust amongst us as to who these fact checkers really are, and called to question their integrity, as it seemed they were working for the government who were trying every means to cover up the shooting and killing of unarmed civilian youths that night, as they didn't want to take responsibility and were not ready to name who gave the military the orders to shoot and kill the youths protesting and to disperse the crowd. These are the issues. If we leave the fact checking to a few organisations, then it becomes very easy for corrupt governments and rich multinationals to use them to stifle protests and free speech. Hence it's a delicate balance between the two.
final_role_type: Legal occupation  (e.g. lawyers, judges, legal support workers, etc.)
